workflow.name: Real-time ISS overhead alert with weather check and multi-channel notifications
workflow.description:
Get notified when the International Space Station passes over your location - but only when you can actually see it! This workflow combines real-time ISS tracking with weather condition checks to send you alerts at the perfect moment for observation.

## Who is this for

- Space enthusiasts and astronomy hobbyists who want to spot the ISS
- Parents looking to share exciting science moments with their kids
- Remote workers who want a unique break reminder
- Educators creating engaging science experiences

## What this workflow does

1. Tracks ISS position every 10 minutes using the Open Notify API
2. Calculates distance and direction from your location using the Haversine formula
3. Checks weather conditions via OpenWeatherMap to determine if ISS will be visible
4. Provides observation guidance including compass direction, elevation angle, and viewing tips
5. Includes crew information showing who is currently aboard the ISS
6. Sends multi-channel alerts to Discord, Telegram, and Gmail simultaneously

## How to set up

1. Configure your location in the Calculate Distance and Direction node
2. Add OpenWeatherMap credentials (free tier available)
3. Set up at least one notification channel (Discord, Telegram, or Gmail)
4. Activate the workflow

## Requirements

- OpenWeatherMap API key (free)
- At least one notification channel configured

parameters.text:
=Generate a fascinating space trivia fact in Japanese about one of these topics (pick randomly):
- The International Space Station (ISS)
- Chinese Space Station Tiangong
- Astronaut life in space
- Space photography
- Satellite tracking
- Space station history

Current context:
- ISS is currently {{ $json.nearbySatellites[0]?.distance || 'far' }} km away
- There are {{ $json.astronauts.totalInSpace }} people in space right now
- Weather: {{ $json.weather.description }}

Respond with ONLY a JSON object:
{
  "trivia_jp": "[Interesting fact in Japanese, 2-3 sentences]",
  "trivia_en": "[Same fact in English]",
  "category": "[ISS/Tiangong/Astronauts/Photography/History]",
  "emoji": "[Relevant emoji]"
}

parameters.content: ={{ $json.predictionMessage }}

parameters.text:
=You are a space observation analyst. Generate an engaging weekly report in Japanese based on this data:

üìä **Weekly Statistics:**
- Total satellite passes detected: {{ $json.totalSightings }}
- Observable passes: {{ $json.observableSightings }}
- Success rate: {{ $json.successRate }}%
- Average observation score: {{ $json.avgScore }}/100

üõ∞Ô∏è **Satellite Breakdown:**
{{ Object.entries($json.satelliteBreakdown).map(([k, v]) => `- ${k}: ${v} passes`).join('\n') }}

üß≠ **Most Common Directions:**
{{ Object.entries($json.directionBreakdown).sort((a,b) => b[1]-a[1]).slice(0,3).map(([k, v]) => `- ${k}: ${v} times`).join('\n') }}

üå§Ô∏è **Weather Distribution:**
{{ Object.entries($json.weatherBreakdown).map(([k, v]) => `- ${k}: ${v} times`).join('\n') }}

Generate a report in Japanese with:
1. üìà ÈÄ±Èñì„Éè„Ç§„É©„Ç§„Éà (Key achievements and interesting observations)
2. üéØ Ë¶≥Ê∏¨ÊàêÂäüÁéáÂàÜÊûê (Analysis of success rate)
3. üåü Êù•ÈÄ±„ÅÆÂ±ïÊúõ (Outlook for next week)
4. üí° Ë¶≥Ê∏¨ËÄÖ„Å∏„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éâ„Éê„Ç§„Çπ (Tips for improving observations)

Keep it engaging and educational!

parameters.content: ={{ $json.weeklyReport }}

### üîÑ Real-time Tracking Flow
Every 5 minutes: Check satellite positions ‚Üí Weather check ‚Üí AI trivia ‚Üí Log & Notify

### üîÆ Daily Predictions Flow
Every morning at 6 AM: Fetch 7-day predictions ‚Üí Format report ‚Üí Add to Google Calendar

### üìä Weekly Analytics Flow
Every Sunday: Aggregate history data ‚Üí AI analysis ‚Üí Generate insights report
={{ $json.notificationMessage }}

## üõ∞Ô∏è Space Station Intelligence Hub
### Advanced Satellite Tracker with Predictions & Analytics

**What this workflow does:**
Tracks the International Space Station and Chinese Tiangong station in real-time, predicts visible passes, provides photography guidance, and generates weekly analytics reports.

**üöÄ Key Features:**
- üì° Multi-satellite tracking (ISS + Tiangong)
- üîÆ 7-day pass predictions with N2YO API
- üå§Ô∏è Weather-aware observation scoring
- üì∏ Camera settings recommendations
- üë®‚ÄçüöÄ Real-time astronaut information
- ü§ñ AI-generated space trivia (GPT-4)
- üìä Google Sheets history tracking
- üìÖ Google Calendar integration
- üìà Weekly AI analytics reports
- üîî Multi-channel notifications

**üìã Required Services:**
1. N2YO API (free) - Satellite tracking
2. OpenWeatherMap API (free) - Weather data
3. OpenAI API - AI trivia & reports
4. Google Sheets - History database
5. Google Calendar - Event scheduling
6. Discord/Telegram/Slack - Notifications

**‚öôÔ∏è Environment Variables:**
- USER_LAT, USER_LON, USER_LOCATION_NAME
- N2YO_API_KEY
- GOOGLE_SHEET_ID
- TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID
- SLACK_CHANNEL

**üìä Google Sheet Columns:**
timestamp, satellite, distance_km, direction, elevation, observation_score, weather, cloudiness, could_observe, location, trivia_category

**Step 1: Fetch Satellite Positions**
Get current positions from:
- Open Notify API (ISS basic)
- N2YO API (ISS detailed + Tiangong)

**Step 2: Calculate Distance & Direction**
Using Haversine formula to compute:
- Distance from user location
- Compass bearing (N/NE/E...)
- Elevation angle

**Step 3: Check Proximity**
Filter satellites within visibility radius (default 800km)

**Step 4: Get Context Data**
- Weather conditions (OpenWeatherMap)
- Current astronauts in space

**Step 5: Score Observation Conditions**
Calculate 0-100 score based on:
- Weather (clouds, rain)
- Time of day (twilight = best)
- Generate camera settings

**Step 6: Generate AI Trivia**
OpenAI generates fun space facts in Japanese based on current context

**Step 7: Format Notification**
Build rich message with:
- Satellite details
- Observation score
- Camera tips
- Astronaut list
- Space trivia

**Step 8: Log & Notify**
- Save to Google Sheets
- Send to Discord/Telegram/Slack

**Step 1: Fetch 7-Day Predictions**
N2YO visual passes API for:
- ISS (NORAD 25544)
- Tiangong (NORAD 48274)

**Step 2: Process & Rank Passes**
- Combine ISS + Tiangong passes
- Sort by time
- Find best passes (elevation ‚â•40¬∞)

**Step 3: Format Report**
Create Japanese report with:
- Top observation opportunities
- Full 7-day schedule
- Viewing tips

**Step 4: Notify Users**
Send prediction report to:
- Telegram
- Discord

**Step 5: Add to Calendar**
Loop through best passes and create Google Calendar events

**Step 1: Load History Data**
Fetch all sighting records from Google Sheets

**Step 2: Calculate Statistics**
- Total/observable sightings
- Success rate
- Breakdown by satellite, direction, weather

**Step 3: AI Analysis**
GPT-4 generates insights:
- Weekly highlights
- Success rate analysis
- Next week outlook
- Observer tips

**Step 4: Format & Send Report**
Combine stats + AI analysis into final report, send to channels

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
